RESOURCE.DESCRIPTION: Helio HEC time based query V1.16.25

INFO.name: QUERY_STRING
INFO.value: SELECT goes_sxr_flare.HEC_id,goes_sxr_flare.time_start,goes_sxr_flare.time_peak,goes_sxr_flare.time_end,goes_sxr_flare.nar,goes_sxr_flare.lat_hg,goes_sxr_flare.long_hg,goes_sxr_flare.long_carr,goes_sxr_flare.xray_class,goes_sxr_flare.optical_class FROM goes_sxr_flare WHERE time_start>='2003-01-01T00:00:00' AND time_start<='2003-01-03T00:00:00' LIMIT 1000 OFFSET 0

FIELD.name: hec_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Event identification number (HEC internal number)

FIELD.name: time_start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start time of flare

FIELD.name: time_peak
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Peak time of flare

FIELD.name: time_end
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End time of flare

FIELD.name: nar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: NOAA active region index

FIELD.name: lat_hg
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Heliographic latitude of event

FIELD.name: long_hg
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Stonyhurst longitude of active region

FIELD.name: long_carr
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Carrington longitude of active region

FIELD.name: xray_class
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Importance of flare at X-ray wavelengths -- the peak flux measured at Earth in the 0.1 to 0.8 nm range in units of Watts/sq meter. (See the 'X-ray Class' in the HEC glossary for the specification of this field)

FIELD.name: optical_class
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Average optical importance of flare -- a measurement of flare size and brilliance. (See the 'Optical Class' in the HEC glossary for the specification of this field)

RESOURCE.DESCRIPTION: Helio HEC time based query V1.16.25

INFO.name: QUERY_STRING
INFO.value: SELECT rhessi_hxr_flare.HEC_id,rhessi_hxr_flare.time_start,rhessi_hxr_flare.time_peak,rhessi_hxr_flare.time_end,rhessi_hxr_flare.nar,rhessi_hxr_flare.x_cart,rhessi_hxr_flare.y_cart,rhessi_hxr_flare.radial_arcsec,rhessi_hxr_flare.duration,rhessi_hxr_flare.count_sec_peak,rhessi_hxr_flare.total_count,rhessi_hxr_flare.energy_kev,rhessi_hxr_flare.flare_number FROM rhessi_hxr_flare WHERE time_start>='2003-01-01T00:00:00' AND time_start<='2003-01-03T00:00:00' LIMIT 1000 OFFSET 0

FIELD.name: hec_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Event identification number (HEC internal number)

FIELD.name: time_start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start time determined from when the flux rate in the 6-12 keV band exceeds 3*sigma above the background level calcualted on a 60s running average.

FIELD.name: time_peak
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of the peak flux for the flare in the energy range greater than 6 keV

FIELD.name: time_end
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End time determined from when the flux rate in the 6-12 keV band drops below 3*sigma of the background level calcualted on a 60s running average.

FIELD.name: nar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number for the closest NOAA active region index

FIELD.name: x_cart
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Position in arcsecs from centre of the sun.

FIELD.name: y_cart
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Position in arcsecs from centre of the sun.

FIELD.name: radial_arcsec
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Radial distance in arcsecs from the centre of the Sun.

FIELD.name: duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Duration of the flare in seconds

FIELD.name: count_sec_peak
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Peak counts/second in energy range 12-25 keV, averaged over active collimators, including background.

FIELD.name: total_count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total counts in energy range 12-25 keV integrated over duration of flare summed over all subcollimators, including background.

FIELD.name: energy_kev
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The highest energy band in which the flare was observed.

FIELD.name: flare_number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An ID number, ymmddnn, e.g., 2042101 is the first flare found for 21-Apr-2002. These numbers are not time ordered, e.g., flare 2042129 occurred before 2042104. Also all sorts of problems have been noted since 2010 has started, and the energy range has been changed, resulting in more than 100 flares in certain days. Flare_ids for 2010 and beyond start with a 2 digit year, and there can be 3 digits for the flare number in a given day e.g., 100601102.
